page.title: 10Bexhill-For the Citizen
page.content: {Unemployment}in Bexhill is quite high. The jobless total for East Sussex in June 1985 was 27384 out of a total of 756153 for the whole of the south east region. The{police}in Bexhill are thoroughly understaffed and overstretched. The public's attitude towards the police is normal, though relations are getting strained. Too much emphasis is placed on teenage and traffic problems by the police, but now, like other towns, Bexhill is switching to community policing.{Crime}is at a fairly regular level, apart from the horror caused by "Dr. Death" over the past few months in early 1985 after his break-out from Northeye prison. There are very few{muggings}in Bexhill.
